– guaranteeing the continuity of the PR.I.M.E. project making sure it has long lasting and sustainable benefits even after its completion, through: 1) a Dissemination Plan of the project’s outcomes that takes advantage of the opportunities offered by the broad national and international networks and its promotional channels; 2) the organization of a job event in which new graduates of the sending Schools can meet national and international companies, umbrella organizations representing small and medium enterprises, Job-Centers and local authorities.
Dual MOB - Dual Training through Mobility

Two of the main problems faced by VET systems in Europe are Early School Leaving (ESL) and the number of students failing to achieve key competences at the end of compulsory education.
VET system has played a main role in fighting these challenges over the years, however in order to continue to tackle early school leaving and equipping students with relevant skills required by the labour market, it is important to foster WBL practices.
Moving from these challenges and considering that the Italian Ministry of Labour and Social Policy launched the Dual System in Italy, the members of the consortium have decided to increase the opportunities for learning mobility during VET pathways that use WBL methodologies.

The goal of the project is to promote, within VET courses that adopt WBL methodologies,  learning mobility period abroad. Indeed, WBL and transnational mobility experiences are important to (re)motivate VET learners (preventing early school leaving) and to provide them with the competences required by the companies. 

Therefore the DUAL MOB project will give students the chance to develop technical competences and soft skills 
through WBL mobility experiences abroad. These experiences will be carried out during VET qualification path and with the final aim of assessing and validating the learning outcomes acquired during the mobility so as to facilitate future inclusion of the young participants in the labor market or to continue their studies.
The project will involve 300 students (1/3 suffering from economic/social/cultural disadvantage) enrolled in VET courses in one of the 150 VET Centres run by the Consortium Members in 18 Italian Regions. 

The project has a wide sectorial and geographical coverage. The sectors in which the students will have the chance to take their internship are the following:
- Agribusiness (Backery and Pastry; Agriculture)
- Arts and Crafts (Fashion, Wood)
- Mechanic and Construction (Mechanics, Masonry, Electric, Electronic, Thermo-hydraulic)
- Graphics
- Administrative, Selling
- Tourism and Catering
- Personal Service (Beauty and Hairdressing)

Furthermore, the partnership will involve 16 partners from 6 different countries (ES, IE, UK, FR, DE, FI). Such a wide partnership will result in fruitful experience for the students, suitable to any professional path. 

The DUAL MOB project promotes 2 different types of Transnational Mobility: 1) 3-4 weeks internships in a company abroad, carried out by students attending an Initial VET course; 2) 3-4 weeks in a VET centre abroad, with periods spent in company or other context, carried out by students attending an Initial VET course. 

The Learning Outcomes will be valorized and recognized through the ECVET system. In fact, the Consortium Members will take advantage of the experience and the ECVET tools developed during the GORES project. 
The project will have an impact on the development of professional and transversal skills of VET students and staff involved (accompanying persons), as well as on the offer of VET  training provision which will be possible thanks to the improvement in the use of the WBL approach and by strengthening the mutual trust among project partners.

This project will also lay the groundwork for enrichment in terms of organizational and teaching methods that the sending organisations may exploit during the pilot project related to the Dual System in Italy.

#FutureReady
Nøtterøy Upper Secondary School has since 2007 held various projects in internationalisation for students in both vocational and general studies. The school acknowledges that in order to solve our shared European challenges, we need to start with bringing change to our local communities. Our focus as a school is on our students to be “preparing for the future, and learning for life”. We take our social assignment seriously and see that internationalisation is an important tool to achieve goals in the county regional plan for the entire course of schooling. There are demands for a holistic schooling with emphasis on quality and relevant training, including establishing arenas for interaction and learning.
Our school has a long-term commitment to strengthening students' understanding of, and expertise in, how to live in a multicultural society built on democratic values and human rights. The importance of internationalisation is well understood by the school management, as well as in the county administration, and our head of department takes an active part throughout the process.
In the Department of Health- and childcare, Krakow was chosen for our student mobilities in order to meet community needs for expertise in migration pedagogy. In Vestfold county the inward labour migration from Poland is significant, and students will meet Poles in their future careers in the Health- and childcare sector.
There is an average of 140 students attending Health- and childcare programmes every year. Student mobility is offered students at year 2 at the Childcare and youth worker programme, the Health worker programme, and to students belonging to our special Health- and childcare programme, where the students become qualified for higher education in addition to receiving vocational training.
The students will be in practice for two weeks either in the privately owned nursery Bright Child, or at Ognisko, public day centres for mentally retarded adults.
At work, the students will take part in the normal day to day activities, but also be expected to initiate and lead planned activities on their own. Students will participate in reflection groups each afternoon and blog about their experiences throughout their stay, as well as complete an interdisciplinary project assignment. While in the host country each student will be sharing a small flat with another student, and together they will be responsible for grocery shopping and cooking, keeping the flat tidy and clean, laundry, being on time for work as well as keeping other appointments.
There will be two teachers present during the entire practice period, and they will be in close contact with the nursery and day centres, in addition to having professional guidance sessions with the students. The teachers will provide support for students both individually and in groups, and make sure they get to sample some of the local culture.
The aim of the international practice is to ready the students for linguistic and cultural challenges in a multicultural society, through first-hand experience of what it is like to work and live in a foreign country. Their reflections underway provide learning for life, and ensure quality of training.
We believe that this will make our pupils and teachers more tolerant regarding other cultures and respect for other norms and values. An experience that can be shared with collegues and other pupils at our school. Increased multicultural understanding will have a positive effect on the  environment at our school. Another competence aim that will be covered is increased knowledge of languages. They will also develop communication- and cooperation skills and increase their social competence. Our school also focus on the cooperation between our two vocational lines of studies and emphasize relevant goals in these two lines of studies.
On the one hand, a long time goal for sending student mobilites to Krakow, is to encourage professional and personal growth, as well as resilience, independence, responsibility and tolerance for each student. On the other hand, we would like students to gain valuable multicultural expertise preparing them for their future careers.

As a school we see internationalisation projects as a way to increase student motivation and thereby up the number of students completing secondary school. IWe wish to promote our as a school offering Healthcare, Childhood and Youth Development as lines of studies. In the longer term we also wish to recruit well qualified and motivated applicants that are suited to work in an open and multicultural Europe.

Finally, the local community expect schools to provide up to date and relevant training for our young people, including multicultural understanding and competence, important to their future careers.

The project is focused on the initial professional training of the third-grade students of the secondary health medical school majoring in nursing and the second and third-grade students of the medical college– branches Diploma general nurse, Diploma pharmaceutical assistant,  Diploma dental technologist and Diploma nutrition therapist. Within the project, two or three-week specialized practical trainings in Great Britain, Spain, Ireland and Slovakia  will be implemented. 43 students from our school will participate during the project period.
The main goal of the project is to extend and innovate professional training at our school through such experience abroad. By
putting the project into practise, students should be able to compare health care system in Great Britain, Spain,  Ireland and Slovakia with the Czech one.
No less substantial aim is the support of foreign language qualification, possibility to check the ability to communicate in a foreign
language and broadening the vocabulary in the field of professional medical English and Spanish. Thanks to the multicultural enviroment, students will also gain knowledge in the sphere of cultural and mental differences of foreign citizens and the development of their personal qualities (like independence, responsibility, tolerance) will also be supported.
Professional experience is the part of educational programmes of the above mentioned branches. ECVET is implemented at this project.  Professional educational stays abroad are to be planned for the very same period when the other students will take part in such working experience in the Czech Republic. After successful finishing of the practical training, students will be given a Europass Mobility and the training will be acknowledged as part of the compulsory practical training.
The output of the project will be a specialist courses for students from the other grades focused on the comparison of experiences
gained in the work places in foreign coutries and in the Czech Republic, or, more precisely, oddities and differences in health care. The mobility participants will present their conclusions and outputs from the project in form of presentations accompanied by photodocumentation. Results of and knowledge gained during the educational stay will also be presented in our school’s magazine, website and in the local press.
Vertiefung der Fremdsprachenkenntnisse und Sammeln von Berufserfahrungen im Rahmen eines Praktikums

Students of BHAK Korneuburg (Secondary College for Business Administration in Korneuburg) receive a sound business education and acquire the ability to communicate, present and negotiate in two foreign languages in business contexts and everyday situations. English and Italian or French are the foreign languages taught at this school. To complement their intensive vocational training students have to complete a compulsory work placement during their school holidays. 
At BHAK Korneuburg the TOP LEAGUE programme has been created to provide additional professional training and incentives for the personal development of top-performing students.
We would like 17 students of the TOP LEAGUE programme to participate in this ERASMUS+ project within the next 2 years.
The objectives of the ERASMUS+ project are to improve students’ knowledge of foreign languages and their intercultural skills. Participation in this project should enhance professional mobility, flexibility and the ability to manage life in a foreign country and business environment. 
The participants are to complete a four-week work placement in relevant foreign companies or organisations in Great Britain, Ireland, France or Italy. 
While the personal development of our students is our top priority, participation in this ERASMUS+ project is also bound to have a positive effect on school development and will enable and promote cooperation with international companies and international school partnerships, which constitute a main goal for BHAK Korneuburg.

Secondary Nursing School and Tertiary Vocational Nursing School in Liberec has prepared a two-year project of international learning mobilities for its students. The mobilities will be realised in United Kingdom and Germany and organised by organising agencies Tellus College a WAD Bildungsakademie GmbH. Both agencies have rich available contacts to nursing facilities and social care facilities and they will negotiate training places for our participants.
There will be 6 two-week learning mobilities realised within the project, 4 in United Kingdom, 2 in Germany. Altogether there will be 56 students and 6 accompanying persons participating in these stays. Learning mobilities will require active usage of foreign language and independence when practising everyday nursing tasks. Participants will have opportunity to gain insight into ways of caring and rules for nursing abroad.
We will implement the project in line with ECVET and we expect its contribution to realisation of our school goals in the field of enhancing the quality of our teaching.
With regard to increasing demands on professional competencies and mainly on language skills we expect not only extension of students´ practical professional skills but also improvement in their language abilities and cultural awareness due to their participation in the project. Such an international experience enhances their employability in our cross-border region where foreign clients are hospitalised quite often.
"ALPEN TRIFFT MEER" - Vertiefung der Fremdsprachenkompetenz und Verbesserung der Beschäftigungsfähigkeit der SchülerInnen der Tourismusschule Salzkammergut Bad Ischl

The project "The Alps meet the sea" consists of a one-month stay in different European countries where the students of the Tourism College Bad Ischl do a practical work placement in various sectors of the tourism industry in the partner companies. The main aim of the project is to improve on the one side their foreign language skills and the employability in the European market on the other. Moreover, the students should also get an insight into the different working methods as well as gastronomic particularities of the European countries. Networking on a personal and professional level should improve the mobility of the young people in order to increase their chances in the European labour market.
Students are well prepared (two foreign languages - common and job-related) and they also receive professional training for the hotel and catering trade. During their stay the partner companies and the mentors of internship will look after the young people. Finally, this project should strengthen the European sense of community.

The project  " Logistic without borders" is based on a strategic target of our school which is to reinforce and support the tech-professional preparation,creativity and trade activities of students. The orientation of the school and the set of subjects to be taught (directional management of transport and logistic activities) predicts that our graduates will be engaged with international commercial transactions. Logistics and transport require international cooperation and  in some substantial ratio are based on it. This project brings to our school another step for intl.cooperation and friendship (we launched it by previous project of worktraining in Hungary) which we would like to extend toward other countries in a way as to allow our students to see and understand intl.comparisons. As a partner for coaction we have chosen a company Tellus College, which works on the UK market and they will help develop our students work opportunities and experience within respective suitable domains within the programme „Work based learning“.
2 groups of 3rd and 4th grade students studying „Transport and logistics“  plus „Logistic  and  financial services“ would participate in the program. We would like to show the students new possibilities which their profession offers within the EU. We shall motivate them and further their education while raising  their qualification. The selection of students will be arranged by our teachers (able to assess their specific knowledge and competencies, incl.language and personal premises). The project will form a healthy competition in the school, inspire an interest among the students in their specialized branches and also help their specific/personal character progress. Work-training abroad will also develop a competitiveness of our students on job market within the CR and other EU countries. 
The project shall implement units of learning ECVET. Worktrainings will be orientated on work in dept.of logistics (activities connected with manual and informational flow of reserves either in written/electronic communication or execution of operations linked with purchase and sale and the use of modern PC  techniques). The result of the work training, in relation to a learning plan, is going to advance specific proficiencies and competencies. Our students will acquire all of them during their work in a foreign company.  Achieved proficiencies of our students will be acknowledged/accounted for within the subject Special training, after their return back to the CR.  The ECVET units were created for this project in cooperation with the foreign partner Tellus in such way to use them afterwards on the national level–within work trainings in local companies. By applying ECVET the foreign partner will perceive the professional profile of a student equally to other students from the EU. During the preparation of this we have planned: the project schedule, organization, project management, accountability of involved partners, implementation of ECVET units, monitoring, evaluation & dissemination of the project.
The task of the school management is to advertise the project and increase the knowledge of possibilities of cooperation in Europe.
Activities for the dissemination and exploitation of results are planned from the beginning, as a part of the project and after its end to include activities aimed at ensuring the visibility, accessibility & applicability. The results of the project (work experience, gained and confirmed skills and competencies of JVU, European cooperation) will be spread by all participants. Students will disseminate the results and experience informally among their classmates, teachers, parents and friends in person, through social networks.
The school will present a summary of this project and its experience to the professional public at the meeting of Association of Professional Schools ICT, postal, banking and logistics, a group for transport, logistics and mail as well as social partners. Another important point is sharing the experience with the implementation of European tools through professional training. This  work experience abroad will be motivating for new students and make our program more attractive for students. By acceptance of ECVET, both the foreign partner and the school or other training organizations would have access to a professional qualification profile and would be ready to participate in all activities associated with Erasmus +.
The main aim of the project is to develop job competencies and partnerships between vocational secondary education and the labor market in the EU, increasing the qualifications of our students with the use of units of learning outcomes ECVET and harmonization with the European Qualifications Framework (level 4) and last but not least student´s personal developments. Choosing the experienced foreign partner and its experience with tools in mobility, shall guarantee fulfillment of our goals.
"Explore, Experience and Learn by Working Abroad “

The project was implemented under long-term needs of the school and  defined during several preparatory project meetings where school management discussed everything with the project manager and teachers of economy and engineering branches.  The most important points were agreed and made into project objectives on which we will focus.   
   Creating this project was based on need to deal with problems created by decreased number of our students caused by population decline. At the same time we want to react to demanding requirements of the labour market where high demand for our graduates speaks clearly in our favour. With this project we want to improve linguistic and practical knowledge of our pupils who will be able to develop professionally, therefore able to find work more easily. Moreover we want to react to their high demand for activities abroad. Unlike grammar schools and business academies our students are usually from socially lower classes and some of them have never been abroad. Our school is also attended  by Immigrants from Ukraine, Romania and Asia.

We approached to the project comprehensively and it will address the issue of improving the quality of education.
Our involvement in this project within ERASMUS+ is regarded as an important element for improvement of teaching as such. The main objective of the project is to increase students’ employability in short supply professions on the labour market not only in regional areas of the CR but also in the international European space. The current motivation of students for further study is also very important for their future profession as well as for development of their foreign language skills. The contribution to quality of education is also expected since students of engineering branch will work with technologies that our school does not provide and gain knowledge of fulfilling tasks given in English language. Studens of economy branch will improve their skills in working with
special economic PC programs, activities connected with setting up a company and its ensuring,  creating and using a bank account.
The expected benefit is also in the shift of teachers‘ thinking in European context together with introduction of ECVET. 
Other benefits for students themselves:
- Obtaining the document Europass Mobility (for better employability at labour market)
- Including of gained results (credits) of education within principles of ECVET without having to be re-examinated
- Increase of readiness for A- levels 
- Improvement of professional shaping up and improving of employability orientation in their branches
- Familiarity with the culture and social environment of GB, its differences and particularities via their staying in host families and participation in afternoon activities prepared by TELLUS
We are planning to send 24 students (12 of engineering branch, 12 of entrepreneurs assistant branch) of second and third year.  All planned activities are based on the same principle, they have the same objective and they will meet the same needs of the participants. They differ only in their professional focus of education branches.  They have a possibility to find their inner motivation to study foreign languages and be employable in other countries in the future.
After approval of the project a general contract (Memorandum of understanding) will be worked out and will be valid for the whole period of project time.
The general contract will be signed by all three subjects (a student, sending and welcoming organisation) before sending students to a specific mobility so called Learning Agreement.
The organizations will proceed together when fulfilling necessary steps for gaining documents for students within Europass – Mobility.
For the assessment of learning outcomes in ECVET, activity units of learning outcomes will be developed for each activity unit where acquired results of learning will be assessed and recorded by welcoming school. 
The skills and knowledge gained from well-prepared internships will be of a great significance in its contribution to the improvement of teaching students. The use of European instruments or certificates in turn increases the quality of work, not only teachers involved but also educational organizations, too. These are, of course, also the goals of this project.

Due to their mobilities, all participants will develop and improve their language and communicative competences, experience new, innovative teaching methods and broaden their horizons in terms of multicultural relations, education towards European unity and the process of globalization.
International mobilities are irreplaceable  in respect of acquiring practical experience. Participation in this project will definitely help us to improve the quality of teaching and motivation of both students and teachers. Moreover, comparing education in other European countries and our attitudes to education and teaching is an inspiring aspect which will move us onwards.

Project "Through British Doors into Europe" should be realised by Secondary School of Applied Arts, Musical Instruments and furniture in Hradec Králové as its first international project in the collaboration with the experienced provider of vocational courses and trainings british organisation  Tellus Education Group.
The formation of the project is connected with the reference to the reliable provider of vocational education training in Great Britain and our need to enhance our offer of study programmes with  international expericence. Considering the offer of Tellus we decided to accept the course included into program "Preparation for Working Life" focusing on construction carpentry. Our students are future furniture makers, only in the 3rd class they  learn basics of construction carpentry but the labour market in the Czech Republic bringst them many opportunities in this branch . They often use them in their summer jobs. The both School and Tellus Educatin Group created the learnig unit on the principles of ECVET - Manufactoring Doors. This activity will be implemented in the training centre under the guidance of the vocational trainer and the Quality Assurance Manager and Internal Verifier. 25 students will take part in 3 practical trainings successively, it will be students of the branch Joiner or the apprentices who have passed the apprentice exam and continue in graduation study. Tellus will organize for visiting  students accommodation, catering and leisure program. 
The project should bring studnets the developments of skills in construction carpentry and improve their rank in the labour market in the labour market in the Czech Republic but thaks to the Europass- mobility in the European  labour market as well. 
The realized projet should become  inspiration for the school to join other international projects. Together with the presentation to  public the project should contribute to the interest in craft branches in our school.

This project builds on a previous nine-year´experience with mobility programmes at our school, thanks to which our students and VET teachers can gain priceless both personal and professional experience by completing a short-term study programme at the workplaces of our foreign partners. 
Within this project, we plan to realize 56 mobilities, out of which 50 are intended for students and 6 for teachers. In the whole, ten groups of students and two groups of teachers will travel abroad for an internship.The increasing number of foreign mobilities and the strengthening of an international cooperation are the basic objectives of the strategic development plan of our school.
The offer of the study programmes at our school has nearly doubled over the past few years and the number of students has increased up to the current 957. 
In addition to the traditional field of study Applied Chemistry being taught in several specializations, there are some new study programmes such as Fire Protection, Security and Legal Studies, or study programme Hairdresser and Beauty Services. To meet the educational needs of our students and allow them to travel to a foreign mobility within their study focus, we expanded our circle of cooperating organizations on the current nine and now we have fully covered all the educational programmes taught at our school with mobilities. We plan to send participants in six European countries (Germany, Cyprus, Great Britain, Spain, Italy, Slovakia 4x). Among our project partners there are six upper secondary technical schools, three universities and one educational center. With four of our project partners we will implement reciprocal mobilities.
The hosting organizations of our Chemistry students will be schools SBG Dresden, Vocational Chemical School in Bratislava, IIS P. Scalcerle in Padua, two universities - the University of Plymouth and the University of Nicosia and a Spanish training centre in Cartagena. Students in the branch of study Fire Protection will participate in an internship at Vocational School of Fire Protection in Žilina (Slovakia). Students in Security and Legal Studies will pass their practice at the Faculty of Security Engineering of the University of Žilina, specifically at the Department of Crisis and Security Management. Another group of these students will complete a course on forensic analysis at Vocational Chemical School in Bratislava. For students in the branch Beauty Services and Hairdresser there is ensured professional experience in beauty and hairdressing salons at Vocational school specialized in hairdressing and making visage in Bratislava. Simultaneously with the increase in number of mobilities, we also strive to raise up the quality of the project. In all mobilities of this project, we will apply the principles of ECVET system and will be testing units of learning outcomes. We will also deal with the procedure of participants assessment. Within this project we also plan mobilities of pedagogical staff - VET teachers as we believe that professional development of teachers is a prerequisite for quality assurance in education. Besides professional and pedagogical skills of teachers we also want to strengthen their language skills. In this project we want to focus on vocational teachers in the field of Security and Legal Studies who will complete work-programme at the Faculty of Security Engineering, and further on teachers in the field of Applied Chemistry who will participate in a working program at ITT Buonarroti-Pozzo in Trento focused on the use of information technology in teaching and learning. On the side of students we see the impact of the project in the acquisition of new knowledge and skills, strengthening linguistic communication and lexical knowledge, improving self-confidence and also motivation for further education. Thanks to this experience students gain an overview of the demands put on their profession, learn about possibilities of study abroad and employment at the European labor market. Through this experience the profile of graduates has been improved, which brings benefit to strategic partners of our school (employers, tertiary education).
On the side of school, we see an apparent increase in the attractiveness of school resulting in an increased interest of studying science. Through mobilities the school receives valuable feedback about the quality of education. The school benefits from the exchange of experience and the transfer of good practice in the practice of school. Within this project we above all want to test the units of learning outcomes and start using them for national mobilities afterwards as well.
The project will be disseminated through the school website, the educational portal of the Pardubice region authority, local and regional press. The project will be presented during the Open Days, at fairs of schools, at workshops with employers and at the project final conference where participants will present their experience.
Novas competências para o futuro III
Futurs Professionnels et citoyens européens des arts du goût et services à la personne en stage en Europe.

Thanks to this project, our school, labelled as “vocational college” for “creative and design”, “culinary” and “services to the individual”, intends to send 36 students in year twelve abroad for five weeks (as an integral part of their 22-week examination preparation programme). They will be divided between  the following destinations: Plymouth (England), Valencia (Spain) and Leuze-en-Hainaut (Belgium).  After a rigorous selection process our students will be preparing for their professional diploma in the following specialities: restaurant sales and service; cooking; bakery and pastry making; support, care and service to individuals.  The possibility of such a period of study abroad has attracted new students and families to our school.  For them, the possibility of a period of study abroad adds value to their professional training, allows them access to a European training programme, encourages them to consider themselves European citizens, and increases their employability. The piloting team intends to help them, both by creating a group dynamic and by offering the logistical and practical help which the students need. In conformity with the programme for the Professional Diploma (baccalauréat) over three years, with our aims and objectives and our school’s mission statement (point 2: recognize the student’s achievement in his/her studies, school and professional environment; point 3: strengthen the students’ interest in arts, culture and citizenship; objective 3.3: promote the mobility of students in Europe and internationally). The objectives of our Académie (wider school district) also stipulate that we are to encourage success among all our students and prevent drop-out by offering personalized training programmes, and also to develop the European citizenship of our students. The countries targeted (Belgium, Spain, England) are suited to the needs of the students concerned since it is necessary to know the dishes and working methods and/or the procedures used in service to the individual in Europe, as well as communication competences in English and Spanish at level B1+ to succeed in the continuous assessment part of their final year examination and to get the European certification (for waiters and waitresses). Throughout their period of training, our students can improve their linguistic competence, acquire professional skills, discover cultural differences, develop their autonomy and their ability to travel abroad, learning about the constraints of working in another country, compare methods, working times, techniques, materials and procedures, all in a foreign language, and becoming better European citizens in the process. They will be assessed by evaluation proformas which will provide evidence of their periods of training in companies and will be used by the assessors (teachers and examiners) in the award of the Professional Diploma (Baccalauréat). The students have the possibility of gaining extra credits for their diploma thanks to this mobility programme which is an integral part of the examination. The student can also show his certificate of work placement, the Europass mobility, a language passport to a future employer, the European certification in service. An active piloting committee is at work in our school, made up of: the coordinating teacher, the Head Teacher, the resources manager, all the teachers principally involved in the project (teachers of Spanish, bakery and pastry-making, cookery, restaurant service and services to the individual). Objectives, needs and expected learning outcomes are reviewed point by point at each stage of the project thanks to the following documents: table of educational objectives, project specification, establishment charter, assessment and validation tools. Meetings with all the partners have been held during preparatory visits and the following elements have been decided: educational objectives and obligatory assessment proformas based on the defined programmes, modalities of the new mobility option and the European certification in the Baccalauréat diploma, professional and everyday needs of the students, the appropriateness of the workplaces and living accommodation of the students, the costs, the accompaniment of the students by those permanently present in partnership with and continuous liaison with the project leader, the students and their parents.The initial impact will be to obtain a good mark in the mobility option and at the European certification of the Baccalauréat, to succeed in the professional assessment of this period of work experience and finally to obtain the diploma. Their capacity to communicate about their experience will also be very important: by sending the report to the partner school, by explaining their experience on the school’s website, the overseas work-experience blog, by talking to future students at the school’s open day, motivating future candidates in the year below, so giving testimonies everywhere.

The mobility of students is a priority for our educational institution, as this is one of the way of increasing the motivation for the professions, which have been decreasing. Offering the students something more, additional encouragment, additional possibility of learning and proving themselves in the professions related to tourism is definitely a good investment for future deal with labor market. The objectives we are trying to achieve with such activities are:
- The acquisition of basic experience and insight into the way of working abroad
- To achive higher quality of education and more practical knowledge
- To help students to get greater personal and professional growth and personal fulfillment
- To prepare students for greater flexibility and motivation in working life and thereby meet the expectations of local employers
 - To promote creativity, competitiveness, employability, entrepreneurship
- To reach new proffesional knowledge and competences, and use them in their home environment
- To upgrade the ability of communicatio in foreign language
- To recognize and respect the cultural and social environment of another nation - to develop intercultural dialogue
The participants will be the students of programme catering and tourism and gastronomy, both those who are in the area of gastronomy, as well as in tourism.
The participants will be getting knowledge in companies in UK. At their return, the mentors and students will transfer the patterns of best practices in to the working environment of the school as well.
The experiences gained on the mobility of the participants will be presented to the students and teachers at school, as well as to the general public, such as representatives of domestic companies, where students are engaged in VET.
The results of the mobility will be presented to the media in the form of articles.

Long-term strategic objective of Izola Secondary School is to become the partner of the environment in development strategies. This can be achieved by adjusting the open curriculum which is designed to achieve the objectives at regional and local level and tailored to the needs of the environment. Considering the changes in the system of vocational secondary education in the Republic of Slovenia, the introduction of providing education in the form of apprenticeship, we want to provide support for the suitable  environment in enterprises as well as in institutions, where work–based learning will be carried out. This can be achieved by developing a close partnership with these companies or institutions at home and abroad and sharing the acquired knowledge. We are aware that this can be achieved by following developments which are happening abroad, by exchanging good practices with similar foreign organizations and by improving foreign language skills. We wish to transfer findings from abroad into the home environment and thereby promote the development of creative solutions to problems in the local region. 
The main objectives of the project are: 
- to implement work-based training of the students, 
- to improve the key technical and practical competences as well as language competences, 
- to develop partnerships between school and employers on national level for the long-term quality cooperation in the implementation of work-based training, 
- to obtain information on good practices at the European labour market regarding the implementation of practical job training, 
- to transfer good practices to mentors of the students on work-based training – mentor training, 
- to contribute to promotion and increase mobility, 
- to contribute to more efficient and more uniform evaluation of learning outcomes acquired during mobility through the use of national and European tools and documents in the proposed project, 
- to promote the school.
We will carry out training for the mentors of work based learning according to the study programmes, where examples of good practice from abroad will be transferred to mentors of the students on practical  training  in companies and institutions, which will contribute to creating the most  suitable environment. The proper training of the mentors will be important especially in the implementation of vocational secondary education in the form of the  apprenticeship.    
We wish to allow work experience abroad to as many pupils as possible. We know that such an experience represents an important milestone in the personal and professional development of any adolescent. Participants in the mobility will not be only improving key technical, practical and language competences but also become more motivated to work, self-confident, inquisitive, productive and most importantly 
self-initiative. This will lead to the rise of the quality of school lessons which will eventually set higher and more ambitious targets and bring excellent results. They will find themselves in a foreign workplace and transfer their experience from abroad  to the domestic environment, which will make them more competent and employable. The  knowledge of foreign languages will be improved, mainly the language of the profession.
The project will involve 15 students from Izola Secondary school who are attending technical secondary education programmes Preschool Education and Health Care. They will be led by the accompanying school staff. The 3rd year students (age 17 to 19 years) will be included. Mobility participants will be adequately prepared for the experience abroad, the adequate jobs and project certification will be ensured. A complete programme will be provided. It will include organizing a suitable accommodation and meals, participation in the preparation of students for mobility, providing a 24-hour support to participants in the mobility, a varied cultural program, a collaboration with project coordinators to ensure quality in all aspects of the programme, transportation to / from the airport, providing local transportation, introduction and orientation meetings, medical care.
All participants will receive a mobility certificate of completion of work based learning as an attachment to the class certificate. They will also receive the Europass mobility to certify the work performed and the experience gained abroad, which adds value in terms of international experience. A certificate of credit points awarded on the basis of ECVET will further evaluate their professional competences.
Lessons from abroad will be transferred to the local environment and thereby we shall encourage the development of creative solutions to problems in the local region. We will build strategic partnerships, which imply the development of cooperation on higher levels. This will lead to joint development and consequently to long-term systemic changes.

There are 2 directions/occupations included into the project: computer technicians and hairdressers. Each of the groups has "specific problems": computer technicians have  problems with practical education in the companies,  the students don't learn as much as they should, though it is very important for them to be up-to-date, since technology evolves fast.  The hairdressers are facing a different problem: practical education at our school. Ovecrowded school salons,  lack of models forcing them to practice on family members or each other, lack of communication with "real" customers, no independence and also in some cases lack of lack of quality vocational training at the employers. What is even more, to be competitive at the labour market, one needs additional knowledge.  
The main goals of the project are  improving the students' skills in practical education (in their own field and to also get additional knowledge), to improve their knowledge of foreign languages, to improve their level of ICT knowledge, for them to learn how to function independently and also as a part of an international team, and nevertheless to become more open to other cultures and various work possibilities. We would also like to take is project as an opportunity for our staff to improve their professional skills, knowledge of English language and to add into the curriculum of practical education (for hairdressers, computer technicians and machine technicians) new topics that will make our students more competitive at the labour market. 
The core of the project consists of 4 mobilities to 2 countries, to Malta and Great Britain in 2 years.  The project involves all together 40 students, 10 students for each round of mobility. Also at each mobility 2 accompanying persons will be present (the Project Manager of the school and the teacher of practical education regarding the students' professional field) all the time of the students' stay abroad. Students included into the project come from 2 different directions: 20 computer technicians and 20 hairdressers. 
The project has 4 repetitive phases/cycles. First the participants will be picked, then preparations will start for the 10 computer technicians and everything will be prepared for their stay on Malta (October 2017, duration 3 weeks, work in companies).  After their stay abroad the students and the accompanying persons will present their knowledge to their classmates/colleagues, the students will fill out a poll and final report, the project team will have a meeting on how the project's goals/objectives were met and there will be meetings regarding the change of curriculum. The students will get their Europass Mobility certificates and ECVET certificate. Then the 2nd stage of the project will begin in January 2018 for the 10 hairdressers going to Great britain (March 2018, 3 weeks, practical traiing in a traininig center), the same procedure as for the computer technicians. In September 20168 the 3rd stage will start for the 10 computer technicians going to Malta (October 2018, 3 weeks, work in companies).   The last mobility will take place in March 2019, when 10 hairdressers are going to Great Britain (3 weeks, work in a training center). 
The expected results are broadened knowledge of the students in the field of practical education and other fields, improvement of the students' language skills, improvement of the students' individual and  team-work, and discovered ideas/options for different ways of work and possible ideas to work abroad . Personally the students will become more independent, more self-confident, open to other environments and cultures,  disciplined, hard-working..., which will make them more competitive at the labor market.  Staff will improve their professional skills, language skills and a change of the curriculum for practical education in the 2 directions in the project will be carried out. 
The project will have long term  benefits for the students because they will be more competitive at the labor market and they will be more successful in life, they will discover new work possibilities. Our school will benefit, because the participants will have new knowledge and pass their knowledge and experience on to other students/work colleagues,  so work at school will get easier and better done,  the changed curriculum will enable future generations to be more competitive at the labour market,  more students will enroll , future project mobilities will get improved and with the partners more future cooperations are possible.

The Consortium of Schools of Economics of Eastern Slovenia (Celje School of Economics, Grammar School Celje - Center, Murska Sobota School of Economics, Secondary School of Economics Maribor, Secondary School Slovenj Gradec and Muta, Novo mesto School of Economics) has formed partnership with partners in the United Kingdom, Spain, Ireland, Portugal and Malta for the purpose of collaborating in the mobility project for our secondary school students from five of our regions that is taking place from June 2017 until June 2018. We are aiming at organising work placements for 139 of our secondary technical school students as well as those of grammar school of economics for a period of two to four weeks depending on their programme. The duration of their work placements has been adjusted to their curricula. All partners are aiming at enabling our participants to get an excellent mobility experience, we want to help them upgrade their speaking abilities in English or teach them the basics of the Spanish/Portuguese language, which means granting their wish. We are going to work hard to broaden their horizons to such an extent so that foreign languages will no longer be a problem but a challenge, we would like them to understand the notion of multicultural existence and be able to live among and with different kinds of people, we want to encourage the use of their professional skills in foreign work environment and gain new professional skills (mostly entrepreneurial and digital skills), including soft skills which are becoming increasingly sought after by employers. It is necessary they become aware of the importance of lifelong learning and training as Europe offers excellent opportunities for international cooperation, networking and exchange of expertise. Student mobility experience has so far - according to our long-term experience - immensely contributed to their strengthened self-confidence, improved self-worth as well as their linguistic and digital competences. In majority we are developing entrepreneurial skills and competences but as we also carry out other educational programmes within our respective schools, the students of the latter have also been involved in the project. 
The project is of utmost importance for all partner schools of the Consortium as mobility activities raise our international profile and attract a greater number of students who want to enrol in our schools. At the same time it provides invaluable new experiences for all of us, including accompanying persons. Nowadays internationalization is a must therefore we are strengthening our collaboration with foreign partners with this project and consequently we keep improving our mobility practice by learning also from their rich experience. Mobility is an added value to our educational programmes and it diversifies everyday activities in all our partner schools be it for students or teachers.

Signing and playing across the world is a two-year international mobility project for preschool education students of Srednja vzgojiteljska šola in gimnazija Ljubljana.  We are a school with tradition and achievements, as well as ambitions. We want to provide our students with contemporary knowledge, develop their critical and logical thinking and we aim towards democratic relations based on mutual respect and responsibility.
There is more than 60-year tradition of preschool education program at our school and we have devoted our attention to the quality of education of the future preschool education professionals. With innovative approaches and variety of teaching methods, we want our students to develop into professional, open, mature and responsible persons willing to follow current changes in the field of preschool education and also looking forward to continuing their professional development.
With this international mobility we would like to enable 64 2nd and 3rd year students to acquire intercultural experiences, enrich their professional experiences and competences, while also developing their self-esteem, autonomy and personal maturity.
The substantial part and the basis of the project will relate to sign communication with children and familiarization with European preschool education systems and traditional games of European countries.   
Reasonableness for sign communication with children in preschool period is to develop students’ skills for encouraging early communication and pre-literacy in children. We want for our future preschool assistant teacher to acquire the necessary skills to provide a suitable environment in kindergarten, promote early learning and provide the necessary differentiation and individualization of children. Sign communication has also emerged as a meaningful implementation in to kindergartens which are highly intercultural. 
Play, on the other hand, is the primary and predominant activity of a preschool child. It is culturally determined but it is also universal. With improving the knowledge of European preschool education systems and with integration of traditional games in these systems, the students will be able to identify professional and theoretical differences in views on the system of preschool education in different cultures and thereby gain the width of an international perspective on their field of expertise. This will allow them the insight into the Slovenian preschool education system and will also give them the possibility of introducing qualitative changes in their work.
Sign communication and play will be used as a bridge between foreign languages, between different cultures in this project, thereby expanding the importance of sign communication in a multilingual environment and play as the basic and the main activity of preschool children.
With this project we aim to:
• Broaden and enrich the expertise of students (in the field of work planning, monitoring the child's development, comparing different technical approaches to preschool education).
• To expand students' knowledge in the field of organizational systems of preschool education in Europe and thereby acquired the width of an international perspective on their area of expertise.
• Develop critical thinking – with analyzing and comparing different systems of preschool education, both through theoretical frameworks and through individual experiences.
• To develop interpersonal and intercultural skills with getting to know and function in a culturally different environment, with the involvement of sign communication as touchpoint.
• To develop personal maturity of the individual student, his responsibility, autonomy, flexibility and ability to work in a team.

The desired effect of the project is to promote a broad linguistic diversity and intercultural awareness and raise awareness of the importance of sign communication with children and the cultural diversity of preschool education systems in Europe and their traditional games. This effect will be achieved with the help of our dissemination activities which will be directed at the following target groups: preschool education students; teachers’ at school; preschool professionals in kindergartens and parents of preschool children.
Brâu în jurul Bucureştiului - tranziţia de la şcoală la viaţa activă prin eficientizarea stagiilor de practică în mobilitate transnaţională

The "Girdle around Bucharest - transition from school to work by streamlining internships in transnational mobility" project  (IF-PractActiv EU) addresses the need to improve the practical training of trainees VET within the consortium in the area of competence specialty culture for which they are preparing to acquire skills and abilities "new knowledge about what the real practice and while a good language training, cross-cultural, pedagogical and key skills.
IF PractActiv EU project addresses the need to ensure access to quality education to rural youth, vulnerable groups and to combat social exclusion.
The "IF-PractActiv I" meet national priority horizontal 'social inclusion' as its main goal: developing social skills, civic, intercultural, media literacy and critical thinking. The project aims sary combat discrimination, segregation, racism, harassment and violence. However, the project responds to priority sector (VET) in that consortium members aim (each) in the Action Plan of the school to develop partnerships with employers, partnerships aimed at promoting learning-based work / activity practice all its forms, with special attention given to the training of students, involving the social partners, companies and organizations / institutions providing vocational training and a specific interest in local and regional dimension, to produce tangible results based.
The purpose of the entire project is to promote among students in four schools, members of the consortium, developing competent professional practice in the field of qualification, social skills, civic, intercultural and improve access, participation and performance at learning of the of disadvantaged groups. In this way future graduates will be well prepared and competitive in the labor market at national and European level. It will also realize the conditions of a harmonious personal development of students by acquiring intercultural and language skills that allow them greater adaptability to the conditions of active life after graduation.
Consortium members are proposing the implementation of the "IF-PractActiv I" the following objectives:
O1: Gaining work experience relevant and useful for future career and accommodate future practical work environment for employment on the European labor market of the 84 pupils from initial training for qualifications from the technological route
O2: Increasing adaptability to environments professional, social and cultural backgrounds through training activities lingvistică and cultural activities in EU countries to the 84 students of the consortium are in initial training qualifications of technological profile areas: Forestry, Agriculture, mechanical, electrical, construction, tourism and food.
O3. improve access, participation and performance of the learning of disadvantaged groups
O4: Strengthen linkages at national and international cooperation for development between work and school, increasing the attractiveness and quality of VET.
Students aged 15 - 18 years and at least 60% between them belong to the category of people with fewer opportunities, single parents, parents unemployed or looking for a job, etc.
Objectives will be achieved through training activities to organize welcoming that focus to achieve maximum efficiency and impact of the project as widely.
Preparation includes cultural visits and cultural activities in their free time and weekends caparte integral activity.
In Romania before departure mobility is developing a program of teacher training, linguistic and cultural.
For every activity that involves a cost, financially responsible will be involved in the actual transaction recording in accounting and payment of services rendered.
Project manager and financial officer will ensure the elaboration and submission to the NA of the final report of the project, according to the program guide Erasus + procedures and deadlines set by it.
Project evaluation will be accomplished through the use of specific assessment instruments: the questionnaire, analysis of documents
Sustainability is ensured by multiplying the results, material support new projects
Professional Training for Our Future Jobs

The project entitled 'Professional Training for Our Jobs' allows the 32 participants from Liceul Tehnologic Voinesti, enrolled in training areas Electric and Trade to acquire learning outcomes from two units of learning outcomes (URI) of the Professional Training Standards, through two traineeships in the Tellus Education Group organisation from Plymouth, England over two school years. From needs analysis it follows that is a basic requirement of the our school that the students  to participate in training activities at local and regional companies or VET school/training center VET institute in Europe. The project entitled 'Professional Training for Our Jobs' ensure all conditions for traineeships at the workplace in an VET organization recognized at the European level for achievement the objectives proposed. The overall objective of the project is  'Increase the professional training of the students for insertion on the labor market' and the immediate objective 'Achievement by participants of skills in the fields of electric and trade in a VET organization in England '. The project is focused on three specific objectives, as:
O1. 16 participants enrolled in the tenth grade, ELECTRIC field of professional training, acquire knowledge, skills and form competence and attitudes form  two units of learning outcomes through traineeships in England over two years.
O2. 16 participants enrolled in the tenth grade, TRADE field of professional training, acquire knowledge, skills and form competence and attitudes form two units of learning outcomes through traineeships in England over two years.
O3. Developing social skills, civic, cultural and critical thinking for 32 participants involved in the project over two years.
The jobs within the Tellus Education Group organisation where participants will perform their traineeships
corresponding electric and trade fields are characterized by a professional surrounding formed through the guidance of the tutors in the professional training process of the participants and the ensuring of the situations and working conditions different from  school training in Romania. The empowering of the participants through work tasks assigned individually or in a team and the  English communication during the traineeshiops using specific English terms and final evaluation conducted by tutors based on practical tests and the certification of the knowledge acquired through learning by Europass Mobility and the participation at the programme 'Preparation for working life' all things are new learning experiences to youth. The participants will proove during traineeship that they can relate to tutors and the staff of the VET organization in order to achieve  the requirements and achievement of the learning outcomes. Also, the participants aware that in a European conetxt  is possible that the learning outcomes acquired in a European country to be validated and recognized in their country using ECVET.  The project ensures activities that require active involvement of the participants by participation in the selection process and school  program and the assumtion of roles and learning in the workplace, communication and socialization  with the host families and involvement in the valorization of the outcomes. The professional and life experience achieved by the participants in the traineeships will develop the level of the professional training of the 32 participants with high chances to employment. The project brings benefits for school, teachers and students by increasing the visibility of the institution with priority at local and regional level and specific  project skills learned by teachers and a greater implication of students in their learning. The project facilitates a greater interest of employers for future graduates, in the present, participants in the trineeshiops . The project entitled 'Professional Training for Our Future Jobs' is an example of good practice for other vocational education schools from Dambovita county. The teachers from VET education schools that participate at the disseminations  will get information and dat, than they can use its to implement VET mobility projects in their schoos. The local community will be interested in the training of the students and will support the educational activities organized in VET education school and in the community. The project entitled 'Professional Training for Our Future Jobs' will be sustainable for two years after it completion, thus the website and EPALE  are tools for the  visibility of the project.

Title: Second Step in Europe 
Theme: Reception issues for Customers’ Care, Management/Administration and Logistic Transport students.

Direct and indirect actors:
- 6 training institutions or placement companies,
- more than 40 companies in 5 countries
- 46 young people preparing vocational high school diplomas in Customers’ Care, Management/Administration and Logistic Transport (level IV, from 17 to 20 years old), 
- The 9 EFP staffs who will go on training period abroad,
- Teachers / Students’ guides,
- The teams at the initiative of the project in the 6 partner organisations,
- The companies which will welcome the participants,
- All the pupils of the other classes and sections, 
- The students’ families,
- The administrative and educational teams, 
- The academic and diocesan authorities
- Our local partners

Where:
- France (sending organisation)
- England, Germany, Spain, Norway and Sweden (recieving organisations).

When:
- Total duration of the project: 2 years 
- A placement of 29 days in March / April, 2018 and 2019

Why:
Our project respects the objectives of the EU, it meets the needs of students’ curriculum but it also meets the expectations of the pupils, eager to discover other cultural and professionnal horizons. We have to adapt the curriculum of the young participants to the new requirements of mobility and adaptability of working life, these future professionals have to become aware of the flows of staffs in a Europe without borders.

Objectives:
- Enrich and develop the professional skills of the young people in first degree training,
- Acquire a professional autonomy and a linguistic ease to fit into an international working team,
- Offer to the participants an experience leading to a qualification,
- Facilitate access to employment thanks to a European mobility,
- Acquire skills in ITC,
- Give an international experience to the students’ CV, a genuine added value for their future recuitement
- Fight against early school leaving and social inequalities,
- Enrich and diversify the educational practices of the EFP staffs 
- Export and import know-hows 
- Give an European dimension to our high school
- Get schools and companies to work together
- Develop a coherent training network 
- Promote understanding and cooperation between European young people

Contents:
- A placement abroad in a company for 27 days, 
- Meetings and workshops with European young people of the same generation, 
- Cultural and professional visits,
- 4 main phases: selection and preparation of the participants (professional, linguistic and cultural), mobility and placement in companies, project assessment and dissemination.

Impacts:
- Acquisition of new skills, 
- Obtaining tools to help the students’ to get a job on the labor market. 
- Improvement the access to employment,
- Fight against early school leaving,
- Renewal and sustainability of the project in 2019,
- Improvement of the teachers’ professional, practical and theoretical skills.
Consortium Inter-académique de Mobilité Européenne dans l'enseignement professionnel 2017-2019

80% - Rate of families in the Hauts-de-France Region eligible to social assistance
27.7% - Regional unemployment rate for 15-24 year-olds, 3.5 points higher than the national rate
17% - Regional early-school-leaving rate in vocational high school, 40% of young people moving to vocational high school after lower secondary school.

These statistics clearly introduce the social, educational and employment challenges faced by our "academies" in Amiens and Lille, and the necessity to set up ambitious projects to help reduce these proportions.

Our academic projects claim a strong focus on European and international openness. Learning mobility, a means of openness, personal and professional enrichment, development of ambition and motivation, is at the heart of this priority. 
CIME_pro 17 project is an emblematic action of this policy.
Inter-academic consortium of European Mobility in vocational education and training, CIME_pro 17 engages 31 vocational high schools around the GIP FORINVAL in a project deployed on the territory of the "academic region" for a larger impact.

Thanks to the PIMEN projects on Lille side, MOPIC / MOPAAM on Amiens side, CALME_sco, the first inter-academic project, our teams have gradually developed a solid experience in the construction, management, implementation and dissemination of learning mobility projects. This project reflects a common, lasting and growing policy of the Academic Delegations to European and International Relations and Cooperation (DAREIC), working closely together for the entire regional educational community.

The CIME_pro 17 project:
- complements the offer of mobility projects on our territory: MOBinov or PIMEN5 projects for vocational education and training, CALME_sco or MOPAAM16_perso for school staff, CALME_sup for higher education students.
- fosters the common will of our academic teams to work together thanks to mobility projects implemented at the inter-academic level (Lille - Amiens): CALME_sco 2015-2017, CALME_sup 2017-2019, CIME_pro 17.
- pursues the networking of our institutions providing vocational training at the local level (with local economic partners), at the inter-academic level (between institutions of our two academies), at European level (with foreign host partners) .

CIME_pro 17 gives the opportunity to 535 young people from 31 of our vocational high schools to carry out a period of vocational training abroad, mainly young people from disadvantaged socio-professional categories, with little or no appetite for mobility, and for whom, professional and personal future is largely obscured by social problems.

A steering committee, composed of representatives from each member institution and the inter-academic coordination team (DAREICs - GIP), will be the decision-making body of the project and will meet on a quarterly basis.

The dissemination activities will be numerous and will concern all the people involved, especially during the inter-academic days of learning mobility that will be organized on our territory.

The impact of the project will be significant:

On the school career of beneficiairy students:
- development of their interest in mobility, transnational professional mobility becoming a reality for many of them
- increased professional, entrepreneurial, interpersonal, intercultural, linguistic and social skills
- reinforcement of their autonomy, ambition and motivation (increased rate of access to higher education)

On the 160 accompanying staff members or teachers who will carry out a training period abroad, and/or on members of the project teams within the beneficiary institutions
- enriching career paths and developing their professional, intercultural and linguistic skills
- professionalization of educational teams in project management

On the concerned structures:
- contribution to achieving the objectives of school projects in terms of European and international openness
- amplification of the local and inter-academic influence of the sending schools
- qualitative and quantitative improvement in the school guidance of lower-secondary-school students to these high schools.
- enrichment and sustainability of partnerships at European level (host partners abroad) and at the local level (reception of foreign students for institutions that implement reciprocal exchanges)

Within our inter-academic territory (Hauts-de-France region)
- Networking of schools and enhanced cooperation between our two academies
- Harmonization and pooling of practices

CIME_pro 17 is an essential and ambitious project for a territory with major challenges.
Projet Académie de Lyon de Mobilités Européennes Sanitaire et Social

The consortium presented here has for objective to contribute to the updating and upgrading of the professional skills of all the participants. The main theme chosen for this project is to “deal with the support of not autonomous people (children, elderly person, disabled or sick patient”. The targeted public is students in healthcare. We want to give them an International experience on their CV, which will be a great asset for their professional future and recruitment

The Académie de Lyon, the GIPAL, 9 French vocational high schools and more than 35 receiving partners in Europe are involved in that project. Motivation and involvement of all them show their willingness to work in team and share skills and practices. It is undeniable that the pooling of resources and practices has provided a new impetus and a new dynamism in the international programs coordinated by Académie. Reiterating this initiative, we confirm our commitment to international mobility of young people and staff with the support of Erasmus Program

This innovative consortium reflects the variety of our Académie with a representative panel of 9 schools in the field of healthcare. Supported by the Rectorat, this project aims at enriching the professional skills of the staff and the students. It also aims at strengthening the european dimension of this Baccalauréat which needs to improve its image and which hasn’t developed any motilities so far. This internship abroad will give an international dimension to the participants’ CV, a genuine added value when they look for a job in the near future. Within two years 68 staff members & 196 students aged 16-18 will work in 13 European countries. These students will be selected on their motivation to invest themselves in their formation. They will receive a linguistic and cultural preparation, which will be evaluated by CERL test on OLS

The objectives respect the recommendations of the EU commission, our decision to offer that chance to the students and staff meets the professional needs of the participants but also their EU recommendations. All of them are eager to discover new cultural and professional horizons. We have decided to share our foreign partners and receiving company lists, this is a real asset because it will create an efficient partnership network and give a greater legitimacy to our consortium on the local and European scenes
The content of the working program has been agreed on by all the partners and they are committed to respect the stages of the project: selection and common preparation of the participants, mobility and internship and finally evaluation and sharing of the impacts and results. These stages will imply a vast panel of people: staff, vocational schools, companies, academic authorities, families, associations, consulates, language assistants in France but also abroad. Each of these step is essential so that the impact felt by all of actors is in line with initial objectives

The role of each partner is perfectly clear. The GIPAL carries the project. The Académie manages the project with the members of the consortium. The piloting committee is in charge of developing the project, of insuring the follow-up, the management and the evaluation of the project. The latter also has to check the financial balance and controls that the various actors meet their commitments. The sending organizations will respect the terms of the mobility program of the consortium. They are in charge of the monitoring and evaluation of the participants. The coordinator has a long experience of the programme and it will support the vocational schools all along the project. So, each one knows one’s mission and it will done seriously

The young people will be more efficient on the job market, they will enrich their professional, cultural and linguistic skills, they will see Europe differently, they will improve their skills in ICT, they will be more autonomous. The partners will develop a network of training organizations, a partnership “company-school” at the European level, exchange innovative practices and give a new image to vocational schools. The staff will improve their professional skills, enrich their educational practices, exchange skills and knowledge and discover other education systems. Expected impact: improvement of the professional, practical and theoretical skills of the teachers. For the learners, it will be an undeniable professional added value which will be transformed into assets on the job market and it will offer career developments to the staffs involved in the project. Expected impact: renewal and sustainability of the project in 2018-2020. These impacts are tangible and easily measurable

To conclude, all the partners will be asked to transmit and promote the Erasmus program in addition to proceed at the global evaluation of this program. This evaluation will aim to analyse positive and/or negative points and allow to adjust practices of all partners for next projects
