This project primarily involves the disadvantageous yet successful graduated or graduated to be who are coming from poor backgrounds, broken families and who don’t have oppurtunity to see the implementations in European countries. The mobile programming are widely began to be used in Turkey and our project aims to show the students the point Europe has reached in using and integrating these mobile programming and automation systems. It also aims both to enable them with an education required by the sector and to provide them by the work experience through a vocational training in the host country. By rapidly changing and developing technology necessity of controlling the systems regardless to time and place is rapidly increasing. 
Every each day this leads to a need in developing more mobile software and gap of a staff member is also increasing day by day. In order to fulfill the gap it is aimed not only to provide the newly graduated with skills and knowledge required by the sector but also to raise them as qualified midman preferable by the business world. Moreover it is aimed to provide these young people with working experience and highly improved skills  and it is also aimed to catch up with mobility updating.  Turkey's share today from the global mobile applications is under %1. In 2017 It is estimated that global mobile application market will reach to 100 billion dollars. The each %1 share We will gain from the market will provide us with 1 billion dollars. Apart of that the BT expenditures  are expected to reach15 billion dollars in 2017. At this point developing the national programming infrastructure and using the national software in various implementations will lead to a great amount of acquisitions.  
Our project will contribute to raise the skilled labour in mobile programming and this will lead to a contribution on  education which will increase employment. The experience acquired by this project will be used in setting the understanding of quality of education in European dimension.  These trainings will encourage the young to produce new ideas and realize these ideas. And these will contribute to improve their skills in taking  responsibility, entrepreneurship and producing. Our project not only encourages the young to be able to built new partnership and communication networks but also encourages them to make researches and making new projects. Thanks to this it encourages to build a dynamic entrepreneurship.
Our project will involve 24 Golcuk MTAL ICT-Electric and Electronic graduates or graduated tobe who applies the selection criteria.
• With this project having  disseminated international ICT certification We aim to raise the skilled labour that our country and sector demands. Consequently We also aim to contribute to education which will increase the employment in our region. 
• To make a contribution in raising manpower in global standarts 
• To contribute in meeting BT expenditures with national sources
• To make a contribution in developing our national programming infrastructure
• We aim to apply the need of the sector to the education 
This project is prepared with the consciousness that ICT will lead our country to a rich and modern country.
Animasyonun Teknoloji ile Eğitime Sihirli Dokunuşu

Every country continues its existence thanks to the citizens living in it. The quality of these citizens directly determines the quality of the country. Besides, education is the most important way for people to display virtuous and knowledgeable attitude. The more importance the society gives in education and the better it’s been applied, the higher the educational level of the citizens who are living in that country will be.

By the development of technology day by day, it is a fact that it has been part of all over our lives recently.Technological developments are important innovations that facilitate and accelerate life.The place and importance of changing and developing technology in education system according to needs is also accepted. As a result of these needs, interactive whiteboards were installed, tablets were distributed to teachers and students within the scope of the Ministry of National Education’s FATIH Project. The Directorate General of Innovation and Education Technologies also established a platform called Education Information Network (EBA).

With the "Young Entrepreneurs of the Future of Mobile Software" which we have implemented in our school in 2015, our teachers and students have been majored in the field of mobile software. Due to this project and after receiving "Animation with Action Script 3.0 Training” which our students of Information Technology department will study abroad, we aim to prepare mobile-compatible interactive educational materials that can be used in EBA platform and students' tablets and cell phones.At the end of the project, the materials prepared by our teachers and students will be uploaded to the EBA platform and offered to students for free with approval from the Ministry of National Education. With this project, students will have more professional skills, increase their foreign language level and enhance entrepreneurial skills.At the end of this project, students are aimed to have the fund of knowledge and experience that Software companies need in mobile programming. This project supports the FATIH Project goals.

“The Magic Touch of Animation on Education By Using Technology” Project has the aim of transferring the vocational education system and different study methods in European Union member countries to our beneficiaries.One of our main objectives is to contribute to the achievement of the Ministry of National Education's FATIH project. Compliance with the Erasmus + programtargets,promoting European cooperation, Europeanism and developing quality awareness areprioritytargets.Effective development of foreign language (English), assessment of job opportunitiesin foreign countries, on the job training the learning methods realized with the help of  Information Communication Technologies(ICT)are other aims of this project.

The project will consist of 28 11th and 12th grade students residing in Sultanbeyli, İzmit and Zuhal Dörtçelik Şenipek of Information Technologies departments of Vocational and Technical Anatolian High Schools in İstanbul, Kocaeli and Bursa 
The international mobility of the project will take place between April and July, 2018in four different countries for 20 days each. ENGLAND mobility will be take place in Tellus, an institution operating in Plymouth. ITALY mobility will be take place in Tellus Italy, an institution operating in Torino. SPAIN mobilities will be hosted by the Oneco and Europroyectos  institutions. The host institution in GERMANY is Iuventas.

Musik zur Förderung von Integration und Sprache

In 2016 the project topic was „Children need Music, Play and Dance – Music as a Universal Language“.
This topic was equally liked by the cooperating institutions as well as the teachers and students because it is versatile and suitable for all fields of practice. Therefore we again have decided on a musical theme “Music as a Means to Promote Integration and Language”.
Music addresses all children and adolescents and contributes in various ways to the integration of children with migration backgrounds. It can be applied through special activities or in an every day context to promote language development or integration of children with special needs e.g. behavioural disorders, developmental delays or other mental, physical or social needs. Music promotes the well- being and emotional strength of the recipients. Music is an ideal means of communication as well as promotion of imagination, expression and creativity for children. 
Singing and performing music together strengthens contact and team skills and contributes significantly to an intercultural education and communication. Music practices listening, concentration, abstract thinking and the processing of information.
The FakS (Training College for Educators) enables students to participate in the process of internationalisation through work experiences abroad, to reflect upon the experience of strangeness and to systematically promote children through intercultural competences. In the context of the school’s development process the following objectives and priorities were stated:
-  prepare future educators for the challenges of an international world of work
-  improve foreign language skills, esp. in their field of work
-  promote intercultural competences and skills
-  implement inclusion 
The Bavarian curriculum for training colleges for educators as well as the  Bavarian curriculum for children in day care emphasize the necessity to systematically promote intercultural competences.
The diversity of values and the necessary communication of values are at the centre of educator training. A constructive debate is vitally important for educators in a plural and globally changing society.
Through additional qualifications we enable our students to expand their knowledge within the generalist training and provide the impetus for “lifelong learning”, e.g. through the project SmS (playing with  your voice) in cooperation with the Academy of Music in Marktoberdorf or the training license for the promotion of physical activity in children and adolescents in cooperation with the Bavarian Sports Association.
Presently the FakS (Training College for Educators) is cooperating with about 300 institutions (at home and abroad) and invites lecturers on a variety of current topics.
The FakS has successfully provided internships since 2001, first through Leonardo da Vinci and later through Erasmus+ thus allowing almost 400 students to do internships in the UK, France, Ireland, Austria and Spain. Several projects received the “best practice” award. In 2015 the FakS received the Mobility Charta as an appreciation for excellent mobility projects and in 2010 it received the Mobility Certificate. The Profile of our college is profoundly characterized by the participation in EU- educational programmes and the experiences abroad are an integral part of our internationalisation strategy.

Due to the successful cooperation all our cooperating partners abroad have increased the number of participants and deepened the exchange of experience with our teaching staff.
In 2017 we are not going to send students to the UK due to the constantly rising intermediary fees and the uncertainty with regard to the impending Brexit. At present we have sufficient internships in other foreign countries, in addition we are looking for a suitable host country for 2018.
In the future we want to emphasize teacher exchanges. So far we have invited guests from at home and abroad to gain an insight into our training system and the Bavarian education system.
As the only training college for educators in Swabia our college is participating in the model trial “Optiprax” which aims at A-level students offering them a shortened period of training. We would also like to offer those students the chance of a work experience abroad. Currently there are financial and bureaucratic obstacles that need to be overcome. We wish as many students as possible to gain experiences abroad thus acquiring international professional competences.

Thirteen years of experience of the Goldenberg Europakolleg (GEK) – both a college of further education and a vocational school- offer an established project background and a perfect basis for the new European programme ERASMUS+. 
Both of the school’s locations are situated in major economically important areas near Cologne. Our cooperation with many successful and internationally active companies in the fields of agricultural machinery, chemistry and the metalworking industry demands a vocational training which prepares trainees, and the teaching staff as well for the challenges of a growing European job market. 
The GEK is a European School which highly values on their European oriented education. One example is the variety of language courses on offer such as English, Dutch, French and Spanish. We consider it to be important that our students have the opportunity to use these languages in real-life professional situations. These take place during a three week internship work placement abroad.
Here, our project background and our project objectives are closely linked. The VET mobilities of trainees as well as trainers lead to an increased cross-cultural understanding of a common Europe.
The experiences of our students abroad lead to a higher self-confidence and encourage them to seek for job possibilities beyond their country borders. Another project objective is that “Europe” is part of the school’s curriculum. Lessons in various subjects deal with topics that are relevant for a European way of thinking. This is supported by the school’s annual European week which offers the students a variety of projects focusing on Europe.   
With the start of ERASMUS+, the GEK is able to offer almost 100 mobility participants the chance to travel and work abroad in 2017/18. This is the largest number of participants so far and follows the plans of our district council in Cologne to raise the number of vocational mobilities to 10%.  These participants are for example technicians for illumination advertisements, electricians for automation engineering, chemical lab assistants, metal workers and technical assistants in the field of design.
So far we have organized VETPRO-projects for trainers and teachers which took them to our partners abroad for one week. Last year they worked under the title “Teaching the European Way”. Our IVT-projects under the title “Different Places-Different Faces” enabled our students to work for three weeks in Finland, Rumania, Malta, Great Britain and on the island of La Palma.
All those activities are now coming together with ERASMUS+ and the GEK is now offering future participants to work under the title “IVT quality+”. In addition to our student mobility under KA1, we also succesfully applied for a KA2 strategic partnership. 
But the GEK does not only send students abroad, we also welcome our partner school’s students from Finland here in the Rhineland area. The teachers and trainers of the GEK organize accommodation and internships with our cooperating companies in the field of electrical engineering, chemistry and design. These internships usually last from four to six weeks.
Our project implementation has been consistently improved and is now divided into 3 main stages: The first stage is the application phase. In this stage students qualify by participating in cross-cultural preparation lessons. Here they also create a europass CV in English and pass a mobility interview, to show their motivation to work abroad. This stage ends in an intercultural evening which prepares all the participants for their upcoming departure day.
The second stage is their actual stay abroad. During this time, the students are monitored, both by the local partners as well as the responsible teachers and trainers of the GEK. The participants document their linguistic, social, personal and professional impressions and experiences in a travel diary called “Travelog”. It is an important instrument of the third stage of the mobility project. This is where the evaluation of the experience abroad is going to take place. With the help of the Travelog their gained competence are documented and can be comprehended. Later on these competences are evaluated in our competence overview, which are used to fill out the europass Mobility certificate.
The project results, their benefits as well as their impact are closely related. The Europass Mobility is one example. It is used for future applications by our trainees after the end of their vocational training, as well as by our teaching staff for better career chances. This document increases their career prospects on both the national and European job market. 
Our collaboration with regional companies that employ apprentices of our foreign project partners, often results in the decrease of language barriers and more cultural acceptance. By implementing our European mobilities we do not only spread the idea of Europe within the GEK but also increasingly on a regional level.
Non-formal And Informal Learning and International Training IN EUROPE AGAIN

The project called “Non-formal And Informal Learning and International Training IN EUROPE AGAIN”, aka “NAIL IT IN EUROPE AGAIN”, is a development of the preceding project as regards its qualified partnerships and the proposed learning objectives, although some new points are also introduced.
The beneficiaries are in-training interns that will obtain their high school diploma (Foreign Languages School or Technical School of Chemistry, Materials and Biotechnology) corresponding to EQF Level 4 and have finished the 4th class of either school branch; among them there are immigrant students, one student with special educational needs and a high percentage of women (consistently with the recommended promotion of the values of non discrimination, social cohesion and active citizenship), for a total of 110 beneficiaries and 20 accompanying tutors. 
The mobilities between 2 and 4 weeks involve a group of 27 partners in 9 E.U. countries which are representative of working and training environments tested in other LLP and Erasmus+ projects, some of them in a relationship of reciprocity. 
These collaborations are varied and interesting and include private companies, Chemistry labs, public institutions, training institutions, universities, museums, hotels, kindergartens and other organizations in the fields of tourism, culture and commerce. 
It has always been useful to work in synergy with organizations such as Xena (for competence monitoring), Padova City Hall, the Province administration of Padova and Fòrema Confindustria for the training of the beneficiaries on the topics of private enterprise and cross competences useful for the world of work, besides helping in the dissemination of the action at a local level.  
Recent school legislation concerning work experience in school curricula provides for quite a high number of compulsory hours of work experience also for the students of the 4th year. Consequently, the participation to the Erasmus+ project is even more effective in helping the school comply with the new requirements and offering the trainees an invaluable experience that might even steer the beneficiary towards specific future working/training choices. 
Although the work placement is an important stage of the process of personal growth for the participants, a good project does not confine itself to the period of work experience abroad, but preliminarily it offers preparatory activities at school that cover the whole span of the project’s life. 
A qualifying feature of the experience is the planning and testing, rich in content and quality, of the Learning Outcomes Units inspired by the ECVET system and of the agreed upon learning objectives with tools such as the MoU and the LA, both with the traditional partners of the CREDCHEM network and with the ones of the educational and tourist fields, with the purpose of acquiring skills that can be transferred to national and international contexts. 
In order to promote this good practice that can be applied in particular in the context of the Technical school of Chemistry, this year more mobilities will be reserved for the students of the Chemistry branch, consistently with the Key Objectives of ET2020 to make science and technology more appealing while improving one’s language skills, strengthening creativity and innovation as key factors of a sustainable economic development. 
High quality skills and competences for employability, innovation, active citizenship and welfare, together with transparency and competence and qualification recognition, are explicitly recommended among the 6 priorities of the 2016-2020 period.  
This important goal is reached thanks to work-based learning provided by the work placements, which have the following objectives: 
• For the Chemistry Technical School: acquiring methodologies and procedures in the field of chemical, biological, biotechnological, environmental hygiene and healthcare analysis; interpreting results and writing reports; using instruments; performing qualitative/quantitative analysis with different methodologies;
• For the Foreign Languages School: developing multilingual communicative skills in the tourist and cultural fields in hotels, tourist offices, libraries, recreation/cultural centres, universities, museums; collaborating in the organization of events, planning itineraries, managing reservations and quotes; collaborating in an educational team by planning activities relevant to the interests of the participants using one’s communicative skills. 
This project supports the teachers involved as tutors in a process of continuous professional development through projects of teacher mobility (ERASMUS+ CLIL O.W.Ne.R.S. 2016-1-IT02-KA101-022762); this opportunity will be taken this year by some of the tutors that have most recently joined the Erasmus+ team, to improve their teaching competence and language skills as teachers of non-language-related subjects.
PLUS - Mechatronics Ultimate Skills in Europe

The project proposal PLUS-MUSE (PLUS -Mechatronics Ultimate Skills in Europe) falls within the programming framework outlined in the Erasmus+ VET Mobility Charter obtained in 2016. The project complies with the Internationalization Strategy described in the Charter application as well as with the recent labour market needs.  
PLUS-MUSE is addressed to 60 recent graduates of VET schools, having developed a technical curriculum in industrial automation and mechatronics and residing in the province of Trentino in Italy. The project is committed to offer on-the-job training through internships in Europe in technologically-advanced companies. The project also includes the mobility of 6 staff aimed at developing better competences in those who will be in charge of the whole in transnational mobility Programming, in a larger perspective.  
As regards the learners, the project will be not only aimed at reinforcing non-formal learning thanks to the opportunity to play an active role in a work context but also at improving their competencies and qualifications for better and faster job opportunities. The mobility learning outcomes will be tailored to the single participant in order to give them the chance to obtain the final qualification of expert in MECHATRONICS AND AUTOMATION SYSTEMS. Along with the professional competencies, the mobilities will also be expected to improve participants’ linguistic and social competencies.  
Participants will be divided into groups of about 6 learners each. Mobilities will take place in Germany, UK, Bulgaria and Spain and will have a duration of 12 weeks. Hosting Partners abroad have been selected in view of their connections with host-companies in the mechatronics and automation sector and their capacity to offer quality internships. The contents and the learning outcomes for the internships will be discussed with the companies and the participants. Participation to the project PLUS-MUSE will be based on an application by the participants on the basis of public open calls. Before the internship abroad, a preliminary linguistic, cultural and pedagogical preparation stage of 2 weeks will be carried out in Trento, to be financed with regional resources. The learners will also benefit from using the European OLS platform. The experience abroad will also include a 3-day initial induction and preparation to the workplacment. At the end of the experience abroad, 2 days of programme follow up will be organized in Trento. 
Upon return to Italy, a second internship experience of 8 weeks in Trentino in the mechatronics and automation sector will be available, this time aimed at work placement. This final stage will be entirely financed with provincial resources. The project identifies specific quality tools which will be applied and combined in the tutoring, monitoring, and certification stage, both by the Sending and by Receiving organizations. 
As regards the 6 staff, a mobility of 4 days will be activated in collaboration with a British Receiving Organization who have already managed several quality internships for the Trentino learners and who have developed special programmes for the improvement of competencies of the key-staff of transnational mobility organizations. The programme will deepen cutting-edge tools, practices, methodologies and procedures, and will have a strong component of job-shadowing and practical observation. The programme will be aimed at improving the competencies of the staff in managing and coordinating VET mobilities, and in enhancing the value of transnational mobility as a training tool.  
The whole PLUS-MUSE project will be accompanied by promotion, monitoring, evaluation and dissemination actions, to take place at the start, during and at the end of the project.
OIKOS - Opportunities and International Keys for Occupational Skills

Liceo Azuni's internationalization strategy is focused on the continuous development of key competences for lifelong learning (2006/962/CE) and for an active citizenship (Decree 22/08/2007 att. 2). Its framework is an educational approach based on meaningful learning and centred on the promotion of the human being. 
This project, which is the initial stage of a four-year plan, consists of a first mobility flow of 40 students towards the United Kingdom, France and Germany who will be coordinated by 4 teachers and 4 members of our staff. 
The middle and long-term strategy aims at a gradual increase of the mobility: from the second year, this will be implemented by expanding the destinations located in the Mediterranean area and/or in the Northern, Central and Eastern European countries; in the third year, due to the expected increase of know-how and operational strategies, we will increase the number of students (up to 50) involved in the mobility project. The time spent abroad will enable beneficiaries to carry out an internship in companies or institutions selected with the support of transnational partners (A1 activity of the present form). The privileged sectors will be consistent with the educational targets of our school: cultural heritage and tourism, public and private institutions operating in the field of communications (primarily for students enrolled in the classical humanities course of our school); art and entertainment, with particular regard to music and dance, will be the fields of interest of some other students (especially those who are enrolled in Liceo Azuni's music and dance related courses).   
These activities will allow the implementation of disciplinary theoretical acquisitions and the development of the ability to transfer the so-called soft skills in the workplace. It is expected that the placements will produce effective results in terms of a conscious study and/or work guidance and, thanks to the Europass certification provided within the project, enhance employability. The habit to intercultural dialogue and the familiarity with foreign languages, as natural outcomes of the mobility experiences, will allow young citizens living in a place strongly determined by insularity, to open themselves up to local, regional and national opportunities, which of course relate to the European context of the knowledge society and to the global market.
These targets are consistent with those identified by the European International Agenda 2020, which is an essential point of reference for our school's educational plan. The latter already promotes the learning of two foreign languages through a series of activities: exchange projects with European schools and linguistic internships abroad (Germany, France, Denmark); collaboration with the local branch of the Alliance Française and with the authorized Cambridge and IELTS test centres in the organization of courses for the achievement of international linguistic certifications. This is complementary to the CLIL methodology, which we intend to strengthen and extend to a second foreign language through the simultaneous mobility of staff members (A2 activity of this form). The latter will be able to optimize the effectiveness of the mobility project and make a direct impact on all members of the school and, by virtue of the formal and informal dissemination of activities among colleagues, improve the ability to change learning/teaching methods. Indeed, the strengthening of linguistic skills, CLIL teaching methods and the use of ITC, objectives shared with the partner organizations, will immediately lead to the enrichment of professional resources of the school, which will be also improved by the exchange of good practices acquired through future experiences of job shadowing. 
We also intend to aim at new curricula that will cover from the starting year the learning of two foreign languages and that will allow the strengthening of student-centred teaching methods that optimize the resources offered by new technologies. 
In view of the fact that a high percentage of students engaged in internship experiences abroad is represented by minors, the presence of teachers as tutors is required (one out of ten students for the entire duration of the mobility). Their ongoing professional support on-site guarantees the smooth running of the experience and its enrichment. Tutors’ function will especially be a continuous, informal monitoring of the placements, in order to evaluate their effectiveness in terms of professional value through meetings with beneficiaries and briefing within the hosting realities. Tutors will also have the task of ensuring adequate living conditions for the young participants.
Sportello Europa 2: la mobilità transnazionale per l'internazionalizzazione delle competenze

The project Sportello Europa 2 aims to pursue the objectives listed in the Internationalization strategy of Scuola Centrale Formazione through the realization, in 2017 – 2019, of 300 transnational mobilities (250 for VET learners and 50 for VET staff), continuing what has been already started with the previous Sportello Europa.

On the basis on different indicators, it is confirmed that in Italy there is a very difficult condition for what concerns the youth unemployment rate (aged between 15-24) at 36,4% (Istat data october 2016), this date is above the european average, despite it is the lowest since 2012; the italian labour market, on the basis on Istat data, seems infact more favourable for the over 50 (+0,9%). The NEET (aged between 15 – 29) are 2,5 millions (26,9%), is constantly growing from 19,5% in 2007, and even more alarming is that the 32% of them is going through this situation for over a year (OCSE data 20015).

Consequently, the project aims to favour and promote:
- Transition processes for young people into the labour market;
- Reintegration processes of young people into education paths;
- Continous staff training to favour “changing” processes;
- Intercultural approaches.

The 250 VET learners involved in the project are:
- included in IVET training paths (2,3 e 4 annuality);
- qualified young people, since no more than one year, in the following sectors: heating and plumbing, mechanic, electric, restaurant (cookery, bar), food processing (bakery), wellness (hairstyle and beauty), graphics and multimedia, administrative, tailoring and fashion.

VET learners mobilities will have a length of 2,3 and 4 weeks in Spain, Ireland, UK, German, Austria and France.
The length of the mobiliy and the choise of the destination country will be closely linked to the tipology of Learning Outcomes identified in each youngster's mobility programme.

The realization of the mobilities will refer to  “the guide to transnational mobility services” (http://www.scformazione.org/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/guida-servizi-GORES-sett2016-IT-5.pdf)
pubblished by SCF to facilitate and to promote awareness among the operators of the sending and the hosting organizations in terms of: 
- selection of the destination country on the base on the companies/sectors excellences to guarantee padagogical quality;
- choise of the mobility lenght in line with the training project of the beneficiaries (training as: strengthening of the acquired competences, intercultural experience; training embedded with the formal path; work experience in addition to the learning path);
- selection of the learning outcomes to be acquired during the mobility through valorization formulas (reuse of the knowledges and of the skills acquired abroad, transfer peer to peer) or utilization of “recognition” procedures through collecting, evaluation and validation tools foreseen by GORES. In particular it will be used in an experimental way  the web platform that SCF, presented to the DoYourMob event 2016.


The 50 VET Staff mobilities are addressed to different professional figures (Trainers, coordinators, tutor, educator) involved in training activities (both professionalised and cultural), tutoring, training on the job, orientation, supporting on the job, etc.
The main proposed topic is  the didactic innovation, observed from different perspectives and in particular:
- work-based learning, digital teaching or in general learning through technologies; 
- internationalization of competences.

For these mobilities we distinguish between to 2 competence areas, in accordance with both Young People and Adult “Target”
- in the first one: IVET learners, including young people at despersion risk, with a physical and mental disadvantage, immigrants and unaccompanied migrant children;
- in the second one: people over 18 (vulnerable persons in generale, e.g. unemployed, immigrants, people with disabilities), with a particular attention to NEET

The VET staff mobilities will last 3-5 days (included travel days)in Spain, France, UK, Finland, Austria and Ireland.
The project foresees, also, 10 training paths of 12 days in Uk and in Ireland for the English language training.


For the VET staff mobility, SCF wants to invest on methodologies:
* WBL in accordance with:
- the coordination of its own network concerning the Dual System experimentation, in collaboration with CONFAP and FORMA (www.lanostraviaduale.it);
- The promotion of the didactic enterprise in terms of pedagogical innovation.
*Media Education in accordance with the investement started in 2013 with the Project INN.

The future development of the Secondary school of Josef Sousedík Vsetín primarily comes from European internationalisation strategy for 2016 – 2020. The school continuously meets its objectives through the action plan for each period. The strategy is focused on three main priorities:

 1. the mobility of pupils and teaching staff,
 2. modernization of the educational programmes and teaching methods,
 3. development of the strategic partnership and international cooperation.

 Continuous raising of the international prestige of the school through the mobility of Erasmus+ is strengthening its position and ranks it among the important secondary vocational schools in the Zlín region.

 The process of implementation of the plan of foreign traineeships for pupils fully corresponds with the objectives of the future development of the school.  A composition of occupations and the number of trainees are observed. Foreign internships will be implemented for 32 students from 5 different professions and will be held in two stages in Chemnitz in Germany and Plymouth in England. The memorandum between The Secondary school of Josef Sousedík and F+U Sachsen gGmbH and Tellus Group will guarantee the ensure of quality internships, fulfilling the requirements of ECVET, Europass – mobility and other certificates. Students will get a unique opportunity to obtain ECVET during the internship in the framework of individual activities, under the guidance of experienced German and English experts. Professional practice will be ensured in workplaces and in companies, which are modern equipped. The development of mobility activities for pupils of the school contributes to the deepening of their skills and experience needed to succeed in international competition and that no matter they should choose to study or work in the Czech Republic or abroad.

1st stage (autumn 2017) – 20 trainers from the fields of Autotronic, Cook, Waiter and Confectioner will work in Germany. Autotronics will complete a German driving school Fahrschule Thomas Hanske. Students will receive theoretical and practical training of drivers of fork lift trucks under the guidance of the instructor. Successful completion of the course will provide them an International driving licence – Operation of forklift trucks, according to CSN 26 88 05 of the Labour Code in § 134b. In another part of the internships they will work in the workshops, they will learn to adjust the aggregates by the operation of the diagnostic equipment, to check the technical condition of vehicles. They will learn to measure emission values. Cooks, waiters and confectioners will work in Saxon restaurants and cake shops, they will learn to prepare typical German dishes and desserts, they find new technological procedures, they will communicate with experts of those fields. Before leaving for Germany all the students have completed language training through online language support.



  2nd stage (spring 2018) -  12 trainees from the fields of Machinist and Plumber will leave for England. Machinists of metals will focus on the processing part of the various kinds of materials, they will work on the machine tools, they will learn to set the cutting conditions on the probe lathes, milling, drilling machines with using measuring instruments. Plumbers will learn how to lay underfloor heating, will focus on the connection of the heat source with using of the moulded joints and joining by brazing. They become familiar with the loading and the connecting special plumbing fixtures. Because of participation of minor pupils, the school is obliged to carry out constant proper oversight, the presence of accompanying persons will be necessary. Pupils will work at different workplaces, in factories and in catering establishments. With the exception of the graduation study Autotronic all the other professions are apprenticeship. These students tend to be less flexible and a little linguistically equipment, often also from a weak social environment. It is also taken into account the size of the working groups, the diversity of individual disciplines for the performance of internships. Accompanying persons will ensure next supervision necessary language assistance they will be educationally act on the pupils, to communicate by telephone with legal representatives of minors.

The school will contribute to the mobility through the endowment fund and will support each trainee the amount of 1,000 Czech crowns to cover a representative work clothing which will be provided with patches of the flags of the Czech Republic, the EU and the flags of the countries of our partners. 

The school strategically planned working travel of professional teachers in future years, the situation was reconsidered and thus leads to a change in the extent of their possibilities. Fomentar nos cidadãos a aquisição e atualização de competências, estimulando percursos profissionais de qualidade

With this project, we intend to continue an extensive experience in carrying out mobility activities in a European context, within the framework of the Leonardo Da Vinci Projects and currently Erasmus +. We believe, however, that it is still possible to improve some practices that foster quality and meaningful learning for the future professional carreer of each participant (students, staff and graduates). Increasingly, these mobility experiences are considered as a differentiating factor in the curriculum of each participant, allowing the acquisition of professional, social and linguistic skills in real working contexts, which can determine a whole future career path. By implementing these types of projects, we meet the participants needs, fostering the acquisition and updating of skills, as well as reinforcing the cooperative relationships that have been developed with the partner institutions / organizations, always seeking to enlarge our partnerships in order to meet the professional needs of participants in a constantly evolving and increasingly competitive European context. With our internationalization strategy, we understand that everyone involved, from the participants to the educational institutions and partner companies, enjoys unique opportunities for evolution and mutual growth. Thus, what each one does best, or simply in a different way, can thus be shared with the other partners. This sharing of good practice has, in our view, been a great advantage for all the organizations involved, and in particular for the people who are part of them. Taking into account the knowledge we have of each partner and the quality of their practices, it is also possible to suggest mobilities according to the needs of each participant, fostering the acquisition of vital skills to stimulate competitiveness and entrepreneurship.
Another important aspect to mention is our constant concern with the promotion of entrepreneurial skills and entrepreneurship oriented towards innovation. In this way, we understand that the accomplishment of the planned activities is also a motivating learning strategy, fostering not only the acquisition of new skills, but also the updating of the same ones, regarding staff mobilities and graduate students, stimulating quality professional pathways. Taking into account our forthcoming relationship with local and regional companies, we know that it is vital to develop new skills and promote transversal skills by anticipating labor market needs in order to improve citizens' life opportunities and foster a sustainable, inclusive and equal growth. This concern has contributed to a continuous evolution and improvement in the realization of these projects.
Therefore, it is our intention, in a long-term strategy, to continue participating in European projects so that our students, graduates and staff have the privilege of enjoying a trainning period in a European context. We believe that this opportunity is a differentiating factor of our institution, which is already recognized for providing this experiences, and for this reason, it is also part of our development strategy for the future. More than ever, companies are asking our students and graduates for certificates of participation in European mobilities, which is a really enriching element for them.
Our strategy also involves an increasing number of participants with fewer opportunities because we live in an area of ​​the country where employment opportunities are scarce and where there is a high rate of emigration, as a means of overcoming social and economic development. In a long-term strategy, it may be necessary to rethink some of our practices, arising the need to adapt to new realities, as has been the case with the participation, more and more frequent, of underage beneficiaries. For this reason, we consider important the existence of the figure of the companion person when performing these mobilities. This companion person can always check the conditions of the training experiences, as well as meet new partners who have recently integrated the project, correct and improve procedures, verify accomodation conditions and strengthen relationships between the various partners. The accompanying teachers are usually people who belong to the working group responsible for carrying out this typology of projects, teachers of the different technical areas of our courses or, also, elements of the school's management, as part of our strategy of beneficiaries and mobilities monitoring.
Nemzetközi gyakorlatok és tapasztalatok a szakképzésben 2017-2019

The aim of Békéscsaba Center of Vocational Training’s Trefort Ágoston Vocational Grammar School, Vocational Secondary School and Student Dormitory to bring vocational training into harmony with the needs of our society, to strengthen our relationship with the participants of economic life, to be involved in innovation processes, to form long lasting relationships with our foreign fellow organizations, with our quality vocational training have positive influence on our environment, to help its social-economic improvement with worthy of Trefort Ágoston’s life-work.
Our application’s central unit is the student mobility with which in this application period there will be a possibility for 71 students to go on vocational training in a foreign country. In choosing the target countries the main viewpoint is the possibility to gain knowledge in high level, to have practice either in a factory or in a school with fruitful experiences. The majority of the mobilities are in factories. We have made an effort that the members of the mobilities cover more vocational areas than before. These planned mobilities cover electronic-electro technical, transport, automation, IT, mechanical engineering and building engineering technician vocational areas in 9 vocations. Beside our traditional European target countries such as Finland we have tight relationships with the bordering, surrounding countries schools’ inhabited by Hungarians. Our international relationships are based on reciprocity as we also receive foreign students or teachers from our partner schools and we organize their programmes in Hungary. We prefer non-profit receiving partner organisations with efficiency in the expenses of spending the subsidy. For the student mobilities we only have accompanying teachers in those cases for the necessary period of time where their present is reasonable.
Our relationships do not stay on only the level of mobility. We strive for professional relationships which are in a long run and active. Békés county’s economic organisations must be active in international competition as they are attached to the European Union’s markets with thousand threads. That’s why it is expected from us to train specialists who are able to be competitive in the European scene with high level of language knowledge, work experience abroad. The student mobility helps on this and in the same time creates the feeling of being European citizen in our students. 
In the case of expert mobilities the primary aim is for the teachers to ensure professional knowledge which is up-to-date and marketable, to get to know the newest achievements and their applications in education. For this reason during all the expert mobilities we create pieces of syllabus which we use and spread around in our fellow institutions. The innovation group which is formed in our school makes diverse activities. That means creating syllabus, technical improvements. These are made together with our fellow institutions. 
In our days it’s a challenge to adopt the zero energy-consumption building’s technological solutions for education. Because of this the expert mobilities concentrate to these areas. The participants are teachers who work in the areas of building technician, building automation and electrical industry. The results of their activities are new syllabus elements. With the usage of these new elements the level of our school’s education is improving.
In the expert mobilites our aim is to involve as much colleagues as we can, we try to avoid accumulation, except the project coordinator and the professional leader. Because of the high quality of the expert mobilities occasionally we invite outer participants. Our activities are in close relation with Óbuda University, with the Chamber of Commerce and Industry of Békés County and with the Government Office of Békés County Employment Major-Department. All these institutions participation rises the quality of the mobilities and creates up-to-date relationship in favour of the social-economical needs. The realization of the mobilities helps to reach our school’s strategic aims in balance with our internationalization strategy’s aims.

Project: Practical Тraining, Innovations, Competences for the Future
ACTIONS FOR ACHIEVING GOALS OF INTERNATIONALIZATION STRATEGY OF VSEE:
As a part of the global world it is necessary to have flexible and adaptive competences, important for successful career realization of specialists with technical education.  VSEE Plovdiv team shows interest in leading the high school to direction – school with high-level vocational training, meeting employers’ needs, not only in Bulgaria but also in global industry. Turning our high school to leading vocational school with stress on fighting early dropping out of school because of low literacy, language limitation, social injustice, will increase the capacity of the region, country and global word with qualified specialists.
 In the period 2015-2020 school team will accomplish the following actions:
1. Institutional commitment for internationalization: network enlargement with business partners, vocational schools, colleges., signing the agreements of partnership with them and European universities, aiming new cooperation; raising teachers’ qualification by gaining international experience, acquired during international mobility or as an accompanying person in students’ mobility; taking part in joint projects with foreign companies presented in Bulgaria; organization and conducting international conferences, seminars, round tables, which present new opportunities for cooperation  and new contacts in academic and business environment; developing new projects of Erasmus+ and participating in motilities.
2. Internationalization of school programs and content:  they will be updated jointly with the international business partners in the field of VET and foreign languages, aiming actuality and high adaptability for international employment.
3. Students: stimulating three-week mobility – practical training in vocational schools, colleges and high-technology companies in the frame of “Erasmus+ “ - 40 participants each year.
EXPECTED DEVELOPMENT: enlarged partners network for innovative and good practices exchange in VET field, social equality and active citizenship; students completed mobility will fill up the lack of vocational skills in the innovative sectors of European Economics with job vacancies in the field of technical science and technologies; our high school will replace the traditional education  and will integrate international inter-cultural and global approaches in training; the education will lead to transfer and accumulating training results, validating qualifications and competences and increasing transnational mobility; VSEE will become modern educational institution, meeting global markets needs with proved authority, focused on professionals, necessary in the society, business, science and education;
According to internationalization strategy and school needs of increasing vocational training of the teachers and students, in 2017/2018 40 students from year 11 and 12 from all vocational qualifications and 5 VET teachers will participate in mobility.
Students’ mobility will be 3 weeks, 15 working days and teachers’ - 1 week 7 working days. These nobilities are based on high number of students - 903 and 68 teachers, most of whom speak English or German.
Planned groups: 
- 10 students  -Vocational Technical School, Liberec , Check Republic, 1 accompanying teacher
- 16 students VET Centre  Tellus Ed Group, Plymouth, UK, 2 accompanying people,
- 14 students VET Centre  Tellus ED Group, Plymouth, UK, 2 accompanying people,
- 5 VET teachers IFOM, Bologna, Italy
The working language for all the groups is English as the language of advanced technologies and education.
The majority of the students-participants will be under 18. We are planning 5 accompanying people because in UK the beneficients will live in host families and will conduct training on different work placements, in different parts of the city. Accompanying teachers will be participants’ tutors and will help them with the logistics and adapting to foreign cultural and language environment. They will aid the successful accomplishment of the practical training, will communicate with VSEE team, will contribute to the integration of acquired competences and experience during the mobility in the strategic development of the vocational school. Profile VET or language teachers in VSEE. 
The selection standards for beneficients, students and teachers and accompanying  people are presented in Appendix 1,  section J of the application form.

The project reflects the strategy of internationalizing the Agricultural Complex of Schools in Namysłów and involves the 4-week foreign vocational training in 2018 for 95 students of the technical vocational school in 5 professions and also the staff training. Three groups of students are going to be trained in May 2018 and these are: 18 students in the profession of an IT specialist in the training centre in Plymouth in Great Britain, 18 students of the technical vocational school of the tourist service will be placed for training in hotels and travel agencies in Rimini, Italy, and 23 students of hotel industry will undertake training in Malaga, Spain.                                 2 more groups in August and in September will be trained in southern Hesse: 18 students of agribusiness in agricultural farms and 18 students of nutrition and catering technology in restaurants and hotels. The project includes also staff training. In July 2018, 5 teachers of vocational subjects of nutrition technology and hospitality technology will take part in a two-week internship in hotels and restaurants of Valencia. At the same time, 3 teachers of vocational subjects of information technology will be undertaking a computer repair and assembly training. A teacher of vocational subjects in the technical vocational school of the landscape architecture will take part in the internship training in a company dealing with floriculture and landscape architecture in Germany. 
         According to the internationalizing strategy, a new hosting organization has been acquired: Sistema Practises ESMOVIA in Valencia. Also the cooperation with current hosting organizations- Tellus College TELLUS EDUCATION GROUP in Plymouth, Sistema Tourismo in Rimini, Starkenburg Farmers Association in Darmstadt, Germany and Tribeka Training in Malaga- will be continued and maintained.
          The main aims of the project are: the development of skills and professional knowledge of pupils and staff, increase communication skills in foreign languages and personal development: increased responsibility, self-reliance, self-confidence, tolerance towards other cultures, to cope with different conditions. The project is important for learning and professional development of students of technical, because it enriches them with new skills and expertise and increases their mobility in the labor market. It enables better prepare future graduates to work to strengthen the European dimension in vocational education and encourage students to gain experience in combining theory with practice, learning about foreign cultures and customs, as well as the development of language skills, especially with language training. The project largely contributes to the mobility and personal development of participants, as it allows to know the culture of other countries, to increase the ability to be among strangers, making new contacts, dealing with difficult situations, growth ambition and self-esteem.
 The main aim of the staff training is to transfer the experience gained abroad to their own work. Practice in related businesses taught sector will contribute to increasing the quality of teaching and extension teaching skills of teachers and students.
        As a result of links between the worlds of work and education, the project improves the employability of future graduates in the European labor market. The project promotes transparency and ability of professional qualifications in Europe based on the European Credit Transfer System for Vocational Education and Training (ECVET).
    Care of the students will perform ZSR teachers and representatives of partner organizations, as well as guardians in individual enterprises. Participation of teachers, as accompanying persons is necessary to provide students with a sense of security, assist in difficult situations or arising conflicts, promote linguistic and control high levels of student learning.
      In addition to acquiring new knowledge and skills outcome of the project will increase the participants' skills in communicating in English and German as well as Italian and Spanish, tolerant attitude towards different cultures and the acquisition of independence and responsibility. Students will take pedagogical, cultural and linguistic course. The project participants will be provided with travel, insurance, accommodation and meals, tickets for transport and pocket money. After completing the practice, participants will receive certificates confirming the acquisition of new skills and the documents Europass Mobility.
   The project contributes to the development of industries in which future graduates will find employment. Long term benefits are primarily the acquisition by the participants of the new experiences that can facilitate employment and transfer of known solutions to the Polish, and the development of a European strategy for the internationalization of the school.
